user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_default_log_handler:
```c
void metal_default_log_handler(enum metal_log_level level,
			       const char *format, ...)
{
#ifdef DEFAULT_LOGGER_ON
	char msg[1024];
	va_list args;
	static const char * const level_strs[] = {
		"metal: emergency: ",
		"metal: alert:     ",
		"metal: critical:  ",
		"metal: error:     ",
		"metal: warning:   ",
		"metal: notice:    ",
		"metal: info:      ",
		"metal: debug:     ",
	};

	va_start(args, format);
	vsnprintf(msg, sizeof(msg), format, args);
	va_end(args);

	if (level <= METAL_LOG_EMERGENCY || level > METAL_LOG_DEBUG)
		level = METAL_LOG_EMERGENCY;

	fprintf(stderr, "%s%s", level_strs[level], msg);
#else
	(void)level;
	(void)format;
#endif
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler language extensions are used in the provided function. All constructs are standard C: the function prototype with an enum parameter, variadic argument handling (va_list, va_start, va_end), use of the standard library functions vsnprintf and fprintf, the static const array initializer for string literals (including the allowed trailing comma), the fixed-size local array char msg[1024], preprocessor conditional compilation (#ifdef/#else/#endif) and explicit void-casts ((void)level; (void)format;) to suppress unused-parameter warnings. There are no compiler-specific extensions such as __attribute__, __builtin_*, typeof, inline assembler, statement expressions, anonymous structs/unions, or other documented compiler extensions present in this code fragment.
